chunk_00001.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — evening, warm interior lighting with neon signs visible.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Ross Geller: light-colored shirt - dark pants - short, dark hair - serious, concerned expression
Chandler Bing: dark-colored sweater with stripes - dark pants - short, dark hair - animated, gesturing
Joey Tribbiani: dark-colored shirt - dark pants - short, dark hair - smiling, engaged
Unidentified person: red dress - dark hair - standing at bar, holding mug

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross, Chandler, and Joey are seated on an orange couch, engaged in a conversation. Chandler gestures animatedly while speaking to Ross, who appears concerned. Joey stands up and walks toward the bar area, then returns to the group. Ross stands up and walks toward the bar, interacting with the unidentified person. Chandler and Joey follow, standing near Ross as he talks to the unidentified person. Ross holds a small white object (an egg) and hands it to the unidentified person, who then hands it back to Ross.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on table)
- Orange couch (center of frame)
- Wooden table (with magazines and a teapot)
- Bar stools (with patrons seated)
- Neon signs: "SERVICE" and coffee cup (on wall)
- Book: "The Complete Works of Shakespeare" (on table)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses a plan involving an egg with Chandler and Joey. The conversation has a joking tone, with Chandler appearing animated and Joey smiling. Ross appears serious and concerned as he interacts with the unidentified person at the bar.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Ross stands up and walks toward the bar
Chandler and Joey follow Ross to the bar
Ross holds and hands an egg to the unidentified person
Ross receives the egg back from the unidentified person
chunk_00001.subtitles: I'm telling you, Ross, she wants you. She barely knows me. We just live in the same building. - Any contact? - She lent me an egg once. You're in. Oh, right. - Hey, Ross. - Hey. [CHUCKLES NERVOUSLY] Come on, Ross. You gotta get back in the game here. The Rachel thing's not happening, your ex-wife's a lesbian, you... I don't think we need a third. Excuse me. Could we get an egg over here, still in the shell? An egg? Yeah. Go up to her and say, "Here's your egg back. I'm returning your egg." I think it's winning. - I think it's insane. - She'll love it. - Thank you. - Thank you. Here. [STUTTERS] Go with the egg, my friend. JOEY & CHANDLER: Go, go, go.
chunk_00001.episode: 1x14 - The One with the Candy Hearts

Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm interior lighting with neon signs visible.

Monica Geller: dark-colored jacket - dark pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - expression: serious, concerned
Phoebe Buffay: patterned top - dark pants - long, blonde, wavy hair - expression: animated, talking
Chandler Bing: light-colored shirt - dark vest - dark hair - expression: serious, engaged in conversation
Joey Tribbiani: plaid shirt - dark pants - dark hair - expression: relaxed, smiling
Chandler Bing: light-colored shirt - dark vest - dark hair - expression: serious, engaged in conversation
Ross Geller: light-colored shirt - dark pants - dark hair - expression: neutral, listening

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel stands near the couch, gesturing as she speaks to Monica and Phoebe. Monica stands with her hands on the couch, looking concerned. Phoebe sits on the couch, talking animatedly. Chandler sits in a chair, gesturing with his hands as he speaks to Joey, who is seated nearby
chunk_00003.subtitles: MONICA: You cannot do this. RACHEL: What? Do what? Roger wants to take her out. No. Pheebs. Don't you remember why you dumped the guy? Because he was creepy. And mean. And a little frightening. Still, it's nice to have a date on Valentine's Day. - Hi. - Hi. You can go out with a creep any night of the year. I know I do. - Hi. - Hi. What are you doing tomorrow night? Actually, tomorrow night depends on how tonight goes. - Oh. Uh, listen, about tonight... - No, no, don't you dare bail on me. She's only going out with me because I'm bringing a friend for her friend. But her friend sounds like such a... Pathetic mess. I know, but... Come on, man, she's needy, she's vulnerable. I'm thinking: [MIMICS CASH REGISTER] Thanks. You haven't been out with a woman since Janice. You're doing this. - Hi. - Hi. - She said yes. - Ahem.
chunk_00003.episode: 1x14 - The One with the Candy Hearts

chunk_00004.subtitles: - She said yes. - Ahem. Yes! Way to go, man. [EGG CRACKS] CHANDLER: Still got the egg, huh? - Yeah. - How do I look? - Oh, um... ...I don't care. There's Lorraine. Now, remember, no trading. You get the pretty one. I get the mess. - Hi, Joey. - Hey. Well, well. Look what you brought. Very nice. And what did you bring? She's checking her coat. Joey, I'm gonna go wash the cab smell off of my hands. Will you get me a white zinfandel and a glass of red for Janice?

Chandler follows Ross into the restroom
Ross peeks out from behind the stall door
Chandler and Ross continue conversation in the restroom
chunk_00005.subtitles: Janice? Oh... ...my... ...God. Hey, it's Janice. Okay, I'm making a break for it. I'm going out the window. No, don't, please. I've been waiting for forever to go out with Lorraine. - Just calm down. - Calm down? Calm down? You set me up with a woman I've dumped twice in the last five months. Hey. Can you stop yelling? You're making me nervous... ...and I can't go when I'm nervous. I'm sorry. I'm sorry. You're right. Come on! Do it, do it, do it! Come on!

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Monica and Rachel stand near the kitchen table, preparing food and talking animatedly, with Monica gesturing emphatically. Phoebe sits at the table, holding a beer bottle, reacting with surprise and amusement to their conversation. Monica briefly walks to the refrigerator and returns with a bottle, continuing the discussion.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Monica discusses past bad boyfriends with Rachel, referencing Pete Carney and Howard, while Phoebe reacts with surprise and amusement. The conversation has a casual, slightly humorous tone
chunk_00006.subtitles: Okay, Roger was creepy, but he was nothing compared to Pete Carney. - Which one was he? - Pete the Weeper? Remember the guy that used to cry every time we had sex? [MIMICS SOBBING] "Oh, was it good for you?" Well, I'd take a little crying any day over Howard, the "I win" guy. "I win. I win." I went out with him for two months. I didn't get to win once. How do we end up with these jerks? We're good people. I don't know. I think we're like some kind of magnets. I know I am. That's why I can't wear a digital watch. There's more beer, right? Oh. You know my friend Abby who shaves her head? She says to break the bad-boyfriend cycle... ...you can do a cleansing ritual. Pheebs, this woman is voluntarily bald.
chunk_00006.episode: 1x14 - The One with the Candy Hearts

chunk_00008.subtitles: By the way, Chandler, I cut you out of all of my pictures. So if you want, I have a bag with just your heads. That's okay. Are you sure? Because you could make little puppets out of them. And you could use them in your Theater of Cruelty. We can't do that. What? What can't you do? Uh, can I talk to you for a second? Over there? Uh, we might be leaving now. Tell me it's you and me "we." She said she wants to slather my body with stuff and then lick it off. I'm not even sure what slathering is. But I definitely want to be a part of it. Okay, you cannot do this to me. You're right. I'm sorry. You're right.

I hope she throws up on you. Thanks. - So... - Just us. Ugh, what a crappy night. Although I have enjoyed the fact that your shirt's been sticking out... ...of your zipper since you came back from the bathroom. [LAUGHS] Excuse me. How you doing? So do we have the best friends, or what? Joey's not a friend. He's... ...a stupid man who left us his credit card.

chunk_00011.subtitles: Can you believe this happened? No, no. And yet it did. - Goodbye, Janice. - Kiss me. Oh, Chandler. Sorry. - Hey, Janice. - Hi, Monica. Okay. Well, this was very special. Rach, come see who's out here. What's going on...? Oh, my God. Janice. Hi. Janice is gonna go away now. I'll be right back. Oh. Joey. Look who it is. Whoa. Oh, good. Joey's home now. This is so much fun. This is like a reunion in the hall. [LAUGHS] Hi, Ross. There's someone I want you to say hi to.

chunk_00015.subtitles: Oh, man. In my next life I'm coming back as a toilet brush. Hello, funny valentine. Hi, just Janice. Hello, Joey, our little matchmaker. chunk_00018.subtitles: I brought you something. Is it loaded? Oh, little candy hearts. "Chan and Jan forever." I had them made special. Okay, Janice. Janice. Hey, Janice. Look, there's no way for me to tell you this. At least, there's no new way for me to tell you this. I just don't think things are gonna work out. That's fine. - It is? - Mm-hm. Because I know that this isn't the end. Oh, no. You see, actually, it is. No, it isn't. Because you won't let that happen.

chunk_00019.subtitles: Don't you know it yet? You love me, Chandler Bing. Oh, no, I don't. Then why do you think we keep ending up together? New Year's, who invited who? Valentine's, who asked who into whose bed? - I did, but... - You seek me out. Something deep in your soul calls out to me like a foghorn. Janice. Janice. You want me. You need me. You can't live without me. And you know it. You just don't know you know it. See you. Call me.
chunk_00019.episode: 1x14 - The One with the Candy Hearts

chunk_00020.subtitles: It's not true. I never called your mother a wolverine. You did so. I swear. I swear to... How long has she been in the bathroom? Uh, I don't think she's in the bathroom. Her coat is gone. Well, maybe it's cold in there. Maybe I screwed up the first date I had in nine years. - That could be it. - Oh, God. You know, this is still pretty hot. Mushroom. Smile. They won't all be like this. Some might even stay through dinner. - I'm sorry. That's not funny. - No, it's just... Well, you know the whole getting-on-with-your-life thing? Well, do I have to?

Ross Geller discusses a personal topic with the unidentified woman, possibly involving a relationship or a past event. The conversation has a playful, slightly tense tone, with Ross appearing earnest and animated, and the woman reacting with a mix of amusement and seriousness.

None observed — characters remain seated throughout the clip.
chunk_00021.subtitles: Well, do I have to? I mean, well, I'm sitting here with this cute woman... ...and she's perfectly nice, you know? But there's... That's it. And, uh, then I'm here talking to you, and it's easy and it's fun. And I don't have to... - I know. - You know? Here's a wacky thought. Um, ahem. - Let's say you and I give it another shot. - Ross. No, no, I know what you're gonna say. You're a lesbian. But what do you say we just put that aside for now, you know? Let's just stick a pin in it, okay? Because we're great together, you know? You can't deny it. And besides, you're carrying my baby. - I mean, how perfect is that? - Ross... You keep saying that, but there's something right here.
chunk_00021.episode: 1x14 - The One with the Candy Hearts

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses the idea of moving on from a relationship with the unidentified woman, telling her it's time to "take the pin out" and find someone else. The conversation has a serious yet tender tone, with Ross appearing earnest and the woman reacting with a mix of affection and concern before leaving.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**

chunk_00022.subtitles: You keep saying that, but there's something right here. I love you. I love you too. - But... - No "but." No "but." You know that thing we put over here with the pin in it? It's time to take the pin out. Yeah. You'll find someone. I know you will. The right woman is waiting for you. It's easy for you to say. You found one already. All you need is a woman who likes men and you'll be set. Not her.
chunk_00022.episode: 1x14 - The One with the Candy Hearts

They are laughing and celebrating, with Monica and Rachel dancing and Phoebe holding a fireman's helmet. Joey and Chandler are standing near the doorway, smiling and watching the others. The group appears to be celebrating a successful event, possibly a fire drill or a themed party.

The conversation has a joyful and celebratory tone, with everyone appearing happy and amused. Monica is animatedly talking to Rachel, who is laughing and reacting positively. Phoebe is also smiling and enjoying the moment, while Joey and Chandler are watching and smiling.

chunk_00023.subtitles: We get off around midnight. Why don't we pick you up then? RACHEL: Okay. MONICA: Great. So, um, will you bring the truck? - I'll even let you ring the bell. - Wohoo! FIREMAN 1: We'll see you later. FIREMAN 2: Bye. See you later. Thanks. See you. Oh, my God. See, there you go. - The cleansing worked. MONICA: You're right. They're nice guys. They're firemen guys. FIREMAN 1: You tell them you're married? FIREMAN 2: No way. My girlfriend doesn't know. I'm not gonna tell them.
